name: Dong Zhou, the Tyrant
text: When Dong Zhou, the Tyrant enters the battlefield, target creature an opponent controls deals damage equal to its power to that player.

name: Doom Blade
text: Destroy target nonblack creature.

editions.flavor: The void is without substance but cuts like steel.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
editions.flavor:
"One little word was all it took. The world shook as I said it. The doom of Zendikar was here at last."
â€”Ob Nixilis
The void is without substance but cuts like steel.

name: Doom Cannon
text:
As Doom Cannon enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature of the chosen type: Doom Cannon deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

name: Doomed Necromancer
text: {B}, {T}, Sacrifice Doomed Necromancer: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor:
"His sacrifice shall not be forgotten. Now toss his body over there with the others."
â€”Phage the Untouchable
Many necromancers share the same last wordsâ€”the ones that conclude the undeath ritual.

name: Doomed Traveler
text: When Doomed Traveler dies, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

editions.flavor: He vowed he would never rest until he reached his destination. He doesn't know how right he was.
He vowed he would never rest until he reached his destination. He doesn't know how right he was.

name: Doomgape
text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness.

editions.flavor: It eats and eats until the juiciest morsel it can find is itself.
It eats and eats until the juiciest morsel it can find is itself.

name: Doomsday
text: Search your library and graveyard for five cards and exile the rest. Put the chosen cards on top of your library in any order. You lose half your life, rounded up.

name: Doomsday Specter
text:
Flying
When Doomsday Specter enters the battlefield, return a blue or black creature you control to its owner's hand.
Whenever Doomsday Specter deals combat damage to a player, look at that player's hand and choose a card from it. The player discards that card.

name: Doomwake Giant
text: Constellation â€” Whenever Doomwake Giant or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Crippling fear precedes it. A foul stench accompanies it. Death follows in its wake.
Crippling fear precedes it. A foul stench accompanies it. Death follows in its wake.
Crippling fear precedes it. A foul stench accompanies it. Death follows in its wake.

name: Do or Die
text: Separate all creatures target player controls into two piles. Destroy all creatures in the pile of that player's choice. They can't be regenerated.

name: Doorkeeper
text:
Defender
{2}{U}, {T}: Target player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard, where X is the number of creatures with defender you control.

editions.flavor: One piercing stare usually convinces thieves to go elsewhere.

name: Door of Destinies
text:
As Door of Destinies enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Whenever you cast a spell of the chosen type, put a charge counter on Door of Destinies.
Creatures you control of the chosen type get +1/+1 for each charge counter on Door of Destinies.

name: Door to Nothingness
text:
Door to Nothingness enters the battlefield tapped.
{W}{W}{U}{U}{B}{B}{R}{R}{G}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Door to Nothingness: Target player loses the game.

editions.flavor: Only a madman could create such a door. Only an imbecile would open it.

"All memory of your existence will be wiped from reality. You will die, and no one will mourn."
â€”Memnarch

"All memory of your existence will be wiped from reality. You will die, and no one will mourn."
â€”Memnarch

name: Doran, the Siege Tower
text: Each creature assigns combat damage equal to its toughness rather than its power.

editions.flavor: "Each year that passes rings you inwardly with memory and might. Wield your heart, and the world will tremble."
"Each year that passes rings you inwardly with memory and might. Wield your heart, and the world will tremble."

name: Dormant Gomazoa
text:
Flying
Dormant Gomazoa enters the battlefield tapped.
Dormant Gomazoa doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever you become the target of a spell, you may untap Dormant Gomazoa.

name: Dormant Sliver
text:
All Sliver creatures have defender.
All Slivers have "When this permanent enters the battlefield, draw a card."

editions.flavor:
"It triggers the hive's period of Ã†theric fertilityâ€”a time when even feeding is a lower priority than reproduction."
â€”Rukarumel, field journal

name: Dormant Volcano
text:
Dormant Volcano enters the battlefield tapped.
When Dormant Volcano enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Mountain you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {C}{R} to your mana pool.

name: Dosan's Oldest Chant
text:
You gain 6 life.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: As Dosan's chant grew in volume, a second, deeper voice rose up in harmony behind it, strong enough to shake the earth and yet vibrant enough to fill the spirit.

name: Dosan the Falling Leaf
text: Players can cast spells only during their own turns.

editions.flavor:
"Each night as Master Dosan prays to the kami, the hate he receives in return withers his body a little more. Though the kami are slowly killing him, still he continues his prayers."
â€”Meditation journal of a young budoka

name: Double Cleave
text: Target creature gains double strike until end of turn. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

editions.flavor: "When in doubt, kill 'em twice."
"When in doubt, kill 'em twice."

name: Double Cross
text: Choose another player. Look at that player's hand and choose one of those cards other than a basic land. He or she discards that card. At the beginning of the next game with the player, look at the player's hand and choose one of those cards other than a basic land. He or she discards that card.

editions.flavor: "You're in for a nasty butt-kickin'."

name: Double Deal
text: Choose another player. Double Deal deals 3 damage to that player now and deals an additional 3 damage to the player at the beginning of the next game with the player.

editions.flavor: "I'm facing defeat, . . ."

name: Double Dip
text: Choose another player. Gain 5 life now and an additional 5 life at the beginning of the next game with that player.

editions.flavor: In a duel and taking a lickin' . . .

name: Double Header
text:
Flying
When Double Header comes into play, you may return target permanent with a two-word name to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Players that don't read flavor text aren't too bright, sorta smell, and dress funny. But let's just keep this between us, okay? They can get kind of violent.

name: Double Negative
text: Counter up to two target spells.

editions.flavor: They feared each other for their differences but were absolutely terrified at their similarities.

name: Double Play
text: Choose another player. Search your library for a basic land and put that land into play. At the beginning of the next game with that player, search your library for an additional basic land and put that land into play. In both cases, shuffle your library afterwards.

editions.flavor: The wizard exclaimed, "I'm no chicken . . . ."

name: Double Stroke
text:
Hidden agenda (Start the game with this conspiracy face down in the command zone and secretly name a card. You may turn this conspiracy face up any time and reveal the chosen name.)
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell with the chosen name, you may copy it. You may choose new targets for the copy.

name: Double Take
text: Choose another player. Draw two cards now and draw an additional two cards at the beginning of the next game with that player.

editions.flavor: "But next time we meet, . . ."

name: Doubling Chant
text: For each creature you control, you may search your library for a creature card with the same name as that creature. Put those cards onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: What's scarier than one of every beast in the forest?

name: Doubling Cube
text: {3}, {T}: Double the amount of each type of mana in your mana pool.

editions.flavor: The cube's surface is pockmarked with jagged runes that seem to shift when unobserved.
The cube's surface is pockmarked with jagged runes that seem to shift when unobserved.

name: Doubling Season
text:
If an effect would create one or more tokens under your control, it creates twice that many of those tokens instead.
If an effect would place one or more counters on a permanent you control, it places twice that many of those counters on that permanent instead.

name: Doubtless One
text:
Doubtless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Clerics on the battlefield.
Whenever Doubtless One deals damage, you gain that much life.

editions.flavor: "Share your devotion with me."

name: Douse
text: {1}{U}: Counter target red spell.

editions.flavor: The academy's libraries were protected by fire-prevention spells. Even after the disaster, the books were intactâ€”though forever sealed in time.

name: Douse in Gloom
text: Douse in Gloom deals 2 damage to target creature and you gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: Orzhov prisoners are steeped in a blackened brew that robs their souls of strength. Patriarchs drink that brew to extend their own lives.
The Mardu warrior was overjoyed when Tasigur set him free and granted him passage through the jungle. He failed to notice the Sultai leader's cruel smile.

name: Dovescape
text:
({W/U} can be paid with either {W} or {U}.)
Whenever a player casts a noncreature spell, counter that spell. That player creates X 1/1 white and blue Bird creature tokens with flying, where X is the spell's converted mana cost.

text:

text:

text:

name: Downpour

text: {2}{G}, {T}: Return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

text:
Flying

editions.flavor: Drafna, founder of the College of Lat-Nam, could create a working model from even the smallest remnants of a newly unearthed artifact.

name: Drag Down
text: Domain â€” Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn for each basic land type among lands you control.

text:
Vigilance
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

Dragons erupt from peaks of chaos and flow from rivers of molten rage.
